title: Revenue house
text:
A revenue house is a type of <a href="multi-family%20residential">multi-family residential</a> <a href="house">house</a> with specific architecture which evolved in Europe during 18th–19th centuries and became a precursor of what is now known as a <a href="rental%20property">rental</a> <a href="apartment%20house">apartment house</a> and a <a href="tenement">tenement</a>. In various European countries this type of house was known as "immeuble de rapport", "hôtel de rapport" (<a href="France">France</a>); "inmueble de inversión", "inmueble de alquiler" (<a href="Spain">Spain</a>), (<a href="Russian%20Empire">Russian Empire</a>), etc.
In France, the spreading of the revenue houses started since the reign of <a href="Louis%20XVI%20of%20France">Louis XVI</a>. Over time, it became a popular investment by <a href="real%20estate%20developer">real estate developer</a>s, which resulted in repeated use of the same type of <a href="fa%C3%A7ade">façade</a>s and overall architecture of the buildings. The proliferation of this kind of property is responsible for the uniformity of the <a href="architecture%20of%20Paris">architecture of Paris</a> today.
